text: I'm Chris yen bamboo I'm the chef and
owner of night market in LA and today
we're gonna make a Thai chili relish
called nut free cool so we're gonna
throw these chilies in the first pan and
then we're gonna put the garlic and the
shallots in the southern pan don't worry
about the charred skin that's basically
what you want we're gonna peel most of
that off just kind of want to turn them
so that they don't completely go black
this is what you're looking for with the
chilies thing is these are super hot and
we're not going able to peel these right
away but I have some that are already
done here and we're gonna go ahead and
work with the use of this stuff so I'm
just gonna go ahead and peel the skins
off face into this ball right here we're
basically only looking for this fleshy
part of the chili right here the inside
but I still like to leave a little bit
of the charred skin on just you know
just because because I like it cause it
tastes good so this is what we're gonna
end up with when we're done peeling we
got the chilies right here the garlic
and the shallots now we're gonna set up
our mortar we're gonna put these
ingredients in one by one I'm going to
start with a garlic
so basically what you want is it is for
the for the garlic to sort of be mashed
up but not to a pulp
next we're gonna add some showers so
again you really want some texture here
finally I'm gonna add in some chilies
I'm just gonna pound that out now as you
can see everything's sort of riding up
on the sides right here so we're gonna
do is we're gonna scrape it down with a
spoon and this is the consistency we're
going for here it's it's really it's
incorporated and what we're gonna do now
is we're gonna season this first we're
gonna put some sugar in and then some
fish sauce
cilantro basically for garnish and then
we're gonna cut off a little wedge and
squeeze in at the very end and there you
go and I'm phreak normal it's a mortar
pound in Thai chili relish from the
north of Thailand and it's it's
delicious
